import * as React from "react"
import * as CheckboxPrimitive from "@radix-ui/react-checkbox"
import { Check } from "lucide-react"

import { cn } from "@/lib/utils"

const Checkbox = React.forwardRef<
  React.ElementRef<typeof CheckboxPrimitive.Root>,
  React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef<typeof CheckboxPrimitive.Root>
>(({ className, ...props }, ref) => (
  <CheckboxPrimitive.Root
    ref={ref}
    className={cn(
      "peer h-4 w-4 shrink-0 rounded-sm border border-primary ring-offset-background focus-visible:outline-none focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-ring focus-visible:ring-offset-2 disabled:cursor-not-allowed disabled:opacity-50 data-[state=checked]:bg-primary data-[state=checked]:text-primary-foreground",
      className
    )}
    {...props}
  >
    <CheckboxPrimitive.Indicator
      className={cn("flex items-center justify-center text-current")}
    >
      <Check className="h-4 w-4" />
    </CheckboxPrimitive.Indicator>
  </CheckboxPrimitive.Root>
))
Checkbox.displayName = CheckboxPrimitive.Root.displayName

export { Checkbox }

import * as React from "react"
import * as SliderPrimitive from "@radix-ui/react-slider"

>(({ className, ...props }, ref) => (

export { Slider }

import React, { useState } from 'react'; import { FileText, Database, Network, Shield, Workflow, Code, Lock, CheckCircle } from 'lucide-react'; const ForensicsPlatformDocs = () => { const [activeTab, setActiveTab] = useState('architecture'); const tabs = [ { id: 'architecture', label: 'System Architecture', icon: Network }, { id: 'database', label: 'Database Schema', icon: Database }, { id: 'modules', label: 'Module Features', icon: FileText }, { id: 'workflows', label: 'Workflows', icon: Workflow }, { id: 'ui', label: 'UI Wireframes', icon: Code }, { id: 'tech', label: 'Tech Stack', icon: Code }, { id: 'security', label: 'Security & Compliance', icon: Shield } ]; const architectureContent = (

System Architecture

Three-Tier Architecture

Layer 1: Presentation Tier (Frontend)

  • React.js with TypeScript for type safety
  • Redux Toolkit for state management
  • Tailwind CSS + shadcn/ui for UI components
  • Recharts & D3.js for data visualization
  • React Query for server state management
  • WebSocket for real-time updates

Layer 2: Application Tier (Backend)

  • Python FastAPI for main REST API services
  • Go microservices for high-performance modules (network analysis, PCAP processing)
  • Node.js for real-time communication (Socket.io)
  • Celery + Redis for async task queue
  • Nginx reverse proxy with load balancing
  • Docker containers orchestrated by Kubernetes

Layer 3: Data Tier

  • PostgreSQL (primary relational database) with TimescaleDB extension for time-series data
  • MongoDB for unstructured evidence (documents, logs, JSON data)
  • Redis for caching and session management
  • MinIO/S3 for object storage (images, videos, disk images)
  • Elasticsearch for full-text search and log aggregation
  • Neo4j graph database for relationship mapping (social networks, transactions)

Layer 4: Processing & AI Tier

  • TensorFlow/PyTorch GPU cluster for AI/ML models
  • Apache Spark for big data processing
  • FFmpeg for media processing
  • Cuckoo Sandbox for malware analysis
  • Dedicated GPU nodes for deepfake detection, face recognition

Architecture Diagram (Text Representation)

Deployment Architecture

  • Containerization: Docker containers for all services
  • Orchestration: Kubernetes for auto-scaling and management
  • CI/CD: GitLab CI or Jenkins for automated deployment
  • Monitoring: Prometheus + Grafana for metrics, ELK stack for logs
  • Backup: Automated daily backups with encryption, off-site replication
  • High Availability: Multi-node cluster with automatic failover

Database Schema Design

PostgreSQL Core Schema

{`-- USERS AND AUTHENTICATION
CREATE TABLE users (
    user_id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
    username VARCHAR(100) UNIQUE NOT NULL,
    email VARCHAR(255) UNIQUE NOT NULL,
    password_hash VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    full_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    badge_number VARCHAR(50) UNIQUE,
    department VARCHAR(100),
    role VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    is_active BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
    last_login TIMESTAMP,
    mfa_enabled BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);

-- CASES
CREATE TABLE cases (
    case_id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
    case_number VARCHAR(50) UNIQUE NOT NULL,
    case_title VARCHAR(500) NOT NULL,
    case_type VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    priority VARCHAR(20),
    status VARCHAR(50),
    description TEXT,
    assigned_to UUID REFERENCES users(user_id),
    created_by UUID REFERENCES users(user_id),
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);

-- EVIDENCE ITEMS
CREATE TABLE evidence (
    evidence_id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
    case_id UUID REFERENCES cases(case_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    evidence_number VARCHAR(100) UNIQUE NOT NULL,
    evidence_type VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    description TEXT,
    file_hash_sha256 VARCHAR(64),
    status VARCHAR(50),
    chain_of_custody JSONB,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);`}

Investigation Workflows

Standard Evidence Collection Workflow

1

Case Creation

Supervisor creates case, assigns investigators, sets priority

2

Evidence Collection

Field agents collect evidence, document chain of custody, upload to system

3

Evidence Processing

System calculates hashes, stores in secure repository, indexes metadata

4

Analysis

Analysts run appropriate forensic modules, document findings

5

Review

Supervisor reviews findings, requests additional analysis if needed

6

Report Generation

System generates comprehensive report with all findings and evidence

7

Case Closure

Final approval, archival, evidence retention policy applied

Digital Evidence Analysis Workflow

Technology Stack & Libraries

Frontend Technologies

  • Framework: React 18 + TypeScript
  • State Management: Redux Toolkit, React Query
  • UI Library: shadcn/ui, Tailwind CSS
  • Charts: Recharts, D3.js, Chart.js
  • File Upload: react-dropzone
  • Forms: React Hook Form + Zod validation
  • Tables: TanStack Table
  • Maps: Leaflet.js, Mapbox GL
  • Graph Viz: Cytoscape.js, vis.js
  • Video Player: Video.js

Backend Technologies

  • API Framework: Python FastAPI 0.104+
  • Authentication: JWT, OAuth2, PassLib
  • Task Queue: Celery + Redis
  • WebSocket: FastAPI WebSocket, Socket.io
  • ORM: SQLAlchemy, Alembic migrations
  • Validation: Pydantic
  • Testing: Pytest, Coverage.py
  • API Docs: OpenAPI/Swagger

AI/ML Libraries

  • Deep Learning: TensorFlow 2.14, PyTorch 2.0
  • Computer Vision: OpenCV, PIL/Pillow
  • Face Recognition: dlib, face_recognition
  • NLP: spaCy, Transformers (HuggingFace)
  • Audio Processing: librosa, pydub
  • Video Processing: FFmpeg-python
  • OCR: Tesseract, EasyOCR
  • ML Utils: scikit-learn, NumPy, Pandas

Forensics Tools

  • Disk Analysis: pytsk3, libewf
  • Network: Scapy, dpkt, pyshark
  • Mobile: ADB (Android Debug Bridge)
  • Hash: hashlib, ssdeep
  • Metadata: exiftool, pymediainfo
  • Email: email-parser, flanker
  • PDF: PyPDF2, pdfminer
  • Archive: py7zr, rarfile

Data Processing

  • Big Data: Apache Spark (PySpark)
  • Search: Elasticsearch, elasticsearch-py
  • Graph DB: Neo4j, py2neo
  • Time Series: TimescaleDB, InfluxDB
  • Caching: Redis, redis-py
  • Message Queue: RabbitMQ, Kafka

Security & Compliance

  • Encryption: cryptography, PyCryptodome
  • SSL/TLS: Let's Encrypt, certbot
  • Rate Limiting: slowapi
  • Input Validation: bleach, html5lib
  • Secrets: HashiCorp Vault
  • Audit: Custom audit logging middleware

Recommended APIs & Services

External APIs

  • VirusTotal API - Malware scanning
  • Shodan API - Network intelligence
  • Have I Been Pwned - Data breach checks
  • MaxMind GeoIP - IP geolocation
  • Google Vision AI - Image analysis
  • AWS Rekognition - Face detection
  • Blockchain.com API - Crypto tracking

Infrastructure Services

  • AWS S3/MinIO - Object storage
  • CloudFlare - CDN & DDoS protection
  • Sentry - Error tracking
  • Datadog - Monitoring
  • GitLab - CI/CD
  • Docker Hub - Container registry

Security & Compliance

Security Measures

Authentication & Authorization

  • Multi-factor authentication (TOTP, SMS, Hardware tokens)
  • Role-based access control (RBAC) with granular permissions
  • JWT tokens with short expiration and refresh mechanism
  • Session management with automatic logout
  • Password policy enforcement (complexity, rotation)
  • Account lockout after failed login attempts
  • Single Sign-On (SSO) integration capability

Data Protection

  • End-to-end encryption for data in transit (TLS 1.3)
  • AES-256 encryption for data at rest
  • Hardware Security Module (HSM) for key management
  • Database encryption at column level for sensitive fields
  • Secure file storage with access controls
  • Encrypted backup with off-site replication
  • Data sanitization on deletion

Network Security

  • Firewall rules and network segmentation
  • VPN requirement for remote access
  • DDoS protection and rate limiting
  • Intrusion Detection System (IDS)
  • Regular penetration testing
  • Security groups and network ACLs
  • API gateway with throttling

Audit & Monitoring

  • Comprehensive audit logging of all actions
  • Tamper-proof audit trail with blockchain verification
  • Real-time security event monitoring
  • Automated alert system for suspicious activities
  • User activity tracking and analytics
  • Compliance reporting dashboards
  • Log retention for minimum 7 years

Evidence Integrity

  • SHA-256 hash calculation on evidence upload
  • Hash verification before analysis
  • Write-blocking for disk imaging
  • Chain of custody with digital signatures
  • Immutable evidence storage
  • Timestamping service integration
  • Evidence seal with cryptographic proof

Application Security

  • Input validation and sanitization
  • SQL injection prevention (parameterized queries)
  • Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) protection
  • Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) tokens
  • Content Security Policy (CSP) headers
  • Regular security updates and patching
  • Code review and static analysis
  • Dependency vulnerability scanning

Compliance Requirements

ISO 27001

Information security management system compliance

  • Risk assessment procedures
  • Security policy documentation
  • Incident response plan
  • Business continuity planning

SOC 2 Type II

Service organization controls for security

  • Security controls documentation
  • Independent audit requirements
  • Continuous monitoring
  • Availability and confidentiality

GDPR Compliance

General Data Protection Regulation

  • Data subject rights (access, deletion)
  • Privacy by design
  • Data breach notification
  • Cross-border data transfer controls

CJIS Security Policy

Criminal Justice Information Services

  • Advanced authentication
  • Audit and accountability
  • Physical security requirements
  • Personnel security screening

NIST Cybersecurity Framework

National Institute of Standards and Technology

  • Identify, Protect, Detect framework
  • Respond and Recover procedures
  • Continuous improvement cycle

Chain of Custody Standards

Legal evidence handling

  • Federal Rules of Evidence compliance
  • Admissibility documentation
  • Expert witness support
  • Court-ready reporting

Data Retention & Privacy

Evidence Retention Policy

  • Active cases: Unlimited retention
  • Closed cases: Minimum 7 years per jurisdiction requirements
  • Audit logs: Minimum 10 years
  • Automated archival after case closure
  • Secure deletion with certificate of destruction

Access Controls

  • Need-to-know basis access only
  • Sensitive case marking with restricted access
  • Automatic access revocation on role change
  • Periodic access review and recertification
  • Privileged access management (PAM)

Disaster Recovery

  • Recovery Time Objective (RTO): 4 hours
  • Recovery Point Objective (RPO): 15 minutes
  • Geographic redundancy across data centers
  • Regular disaster recovery drills
  • Backup verification and testing

Security Best Practices Checklist

replit.md.content:
# CPT Digital Forensics Platform

## Overview
Comprehensive Digital Forensics & Cyber Investigation Web Application Platform designed for law enforcement, cyber cells, and security agencies. The platform features 36 specialized forensic modules with professional dark-themed UI matching law enforcement aesthetics.

## Project Architecture
**Stack**: Full-stack JavaScript application
- **Frontend**: React + TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, Shadcn UI
- **Backend**: Express.js + Node.js
- **Database**: PostgreSQL (Neon) with Drizzle ORM
- **Authentication**: Replit Auth with role-based access control
- **Charts**: Recharts for data visualization

## Core Features

### Authentication & Access Control
- Replit Auth integration with 4 role levels:
  - **Admin**: Full system access + configuration
  - **Analyst**: Standard forensic module access
  - **Supervisor**: Read-only + approval workflows
  - **Auditor**: Audit trails + reports only

### Case Management System
- Create and track investigation cases
- Assign cases to analysts
- Track case status (open, in_progress, closed, archived)
- Priority levels (low, medium, high, critical)
- Complete case timeline and history

### Evidence Management
- Secure evidence upload with SHA-256 hash verification
- Chain-of-custody tracking with complete audit trail
- Evidence categorization by type (image, video, document, mobile, network, etc.)
- File metadata extraction
- Evidence integrity verification

### 36 Forensic Modules (MVP includes 20+ modules)

#### AI & Media Analysis
1. **AI/Deepfake Detection** - Advanced AI-powered deepfake detection
2. **Image Forensics** - EXIF metadata extraction, tampering detection
3. **Video/CCTV Analysis** - Frame-by-frame analysis, enhancement
4. **Audio Forensics** - Noise reduction, speaker verification
5. **Steganography Detection** - Hidden data scanner

#### Network & Communications
6. **Network Traffic Analyzer** - PCAP analysis, protocol breakdown
7. **Email Forensics** - Header analysis, sender verification
8. **CDR/IPDR Analysis** - Communication logs analyzer
9. **Dark Web Investigation** - Dark web monitoring
10. **Browser Forensics** - Web browser history and artifact analysis

#### Device & Hardware
11. **Mobile Forensics** - App data analysis, SQLite database viewer
12. **Disk Forensics** - Deleted file recovery, disk imaging
13. **Drone Forensics** - Flight log, GPS, media extraction
14. **Vehicle Forensics** - ECU, GPS, infotainment analysis
15. **GPS Analysis** - Location metadata analyzer

#### Financial & Fraud
16. **Banking Fraud Investigation** - UPI/IMPS/Card fraud detection
17. **AML/CTF Investigation** - Transaction graph mapping
18. **Blockchain Tracing** - Crypto transaction analysis
19. **Financial Audit** - Corporate forensic audit

#### Social & OSINT
20. **Social Media Forensics** - Profile data extraction, timeline visualization
21. **OSINT Intelligence** - Open source intelligence gathering
22. **Face Recognition** - Facial matching and comparison
23. **Document Forgery Detection** - PDF/image authenticity verification

### Dashboard & Analytics
- Real-time KPI metrics (active cases, evidence count, analyses)
- Weekly activity charts
- Case distribution by status
- Module usage statistics
- Recent activity timeline
- Interactive data visualizations

### Audit & Compliance
- Complete audit log system tracking all user actions
- IP address and user agent logging
- Timestamp tracking for all operations
- Chain-of-custody maintenance
- Evidence hash verification
- Legal compliance for chain-of-evidence

## Database Schema

### Core Tables
- **users**: User accounts with role-based access
- **cases**: Investigation case records
- **evidence**: Evidence files with hash verification
- **chain_of_custody**: Evidence custody tracking
- **analysis_results**: Forensic analysis outputs (JSON)
- **audit_logs**: Complete system audit trail
- **sessions**: Authentication session storage

### Key Relationships
- Cases â†’ Evidence (one-to-many)
- Evidence â†’ Chain of Custody (one-to-many)
- Cases â†’ Analysis Results (one-to-many)
- Evidence â†’ Analysis Results (one-to-many)
- Users â†’ Cases (assigned, created)
- Users â†’ Evidence (collected by)
- Users â†’ Audit Logs (activity tracking)

## Design System
- **Theme**: Professional dark mode with blue law enforcement accents
- **Typography**: IBM Plex Sans (UI), IBM Plex Mono (technical data)
- **Colors**: 
  - Primary: Blue (#214395) for trust and authority
  - Charts: 5-color palette for data visualization
  - Status indicators: Color-coded badges for case/evidence status
- **Layout**: Sidebar navigation with 8 collapsible module categories
- **Components**: Shadcn UI components with custom forensics styling

## Technical Implementation

### Frontend Structure
```
client/src/
â”œâ”€â”€ pages/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ landing.tsx - Public landing page
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ dashboard.tsx - Main analytics dashboard
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ cases.tsx - Case management interface
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ evidence.tsx - Image forensics module
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ modules/
â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ ai-deepfake.tsx
â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ social-media.tsx
â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ network-traffic.tsx
â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ face-recognition.tsx
â”‚       â””â”€â”€ mobile-forensics.tsx
â”œâ”€â”€ components/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ app-sidebar.tsx - Navigation sidebar
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ theme-toggle.tsx - Dark/light mode toggle
â””â”€â”€ hooks/
    â””â”€â”€ useAuth.ts - Authentication hook
```

### Backend Structure
```
server/
â”œâ”€â”€ routes.ts - API endpoints
â”œâ”€â”€ storage.ts - Database operations (IStorage interface)
â”œâ”€â”€ db.ts - Database connection
â””â”€â”€ replitAuth.ts - Authentication middleware
```

### API Endpoints
- `GET /api/auth/user` - Get current user
- `GET /api/stats` - Dashboard statistics
- `GET /api/cases` - List all cases
- `POST /api/cases` - Create new case
- `GET /api/evidence` - List evidence
- `POST /api/evidence` - Upload evidence
- `POST /api/analysis` - Create analysis result
- `GET /api/audit-logs` - Retrieve audit logs

## Development Workflow

### Prerequisites
- Node.js 20
- PostgreSQL database (provisioned via Replit)
- Replit Auth configured

### Environment Variables
- `DATABASE_URL` - PostgreSQL connection string
- `SESSION_SECRET` - Session encryption secret
- `REPL_ID` - Replit application ID
- `ISSUER_URL` - OIDC issuer URL (defaults to Replit)

### Commands
- `npm run dev` - Start development server
- `npm run db:push` - Push database schema changes

## Security Features
- SHA-256 hash verification for all evidence
- Complete chain-of-custody logging
- Role-based access control (RBAC)
- Audit trail for all system operations
- Secure session management
- PostgreSQL for data persistence
- Evidence integrity verification

## Future Enhancements (Phase 2)
- GPU-accelerated AI processing for video analysis
- Real-time collaboration features with WebSocket
- 3D graph mapping for relationship analysis (Neo4j)
- Mobile field application for Cyber Forensics Van
- Advanced encryption recovery toolkit
- Automated cloud evidence acquisition (AWS, GDrive, iCloud)
- Elasticsearch for full-text search
- Batch processing capabilities
- Advanced compliance reporting
- Malware sandbox environment
- Remaining 16 advanced modules

## Recent Changes
- 2025-01-31: Initial platform setup with core infrastructure
- Database schema created with all forensic tables
- Replit Auth integration with role-based access
- Dashboard with KPI metrics and visualizations
- Case Management system implemented
- 6+ forensic modules created (AI/Deepfake, Social Media, Image Forensics, Network Traffic, Face Recognition, Mobile Forensics)
- Professional dark-themed UI with IBM Carbon design system
- Comprehensive sidebar navigation for 36 modules

## User Preferences
- Default theme: Dark mode (professional law enforcement aesthetic)
- Professional blue color scheme (#214395)
- High information density layout
- Collapsible sidebar navigation
- Real-time data visualization preferred

## Notes
- All evidence files require SHA-256 hash verification
- Chain-of-custody must be maintained for legal compliance
- Audit logs capture IP addresses and user agents
- Module results stored as JSONB for flexibility
- Analysis confidence scores range 0-100
- Case numbers follow format: CASE-YYYY-NNNN

design_guidelines.md.content:
# Digital Forensics Platform - Design Guidelines (Compacted) ## Design System: IBM Carbon **Rationale:** Enterprise-grade, data-heavy applications requiring professional authority and consistency across 36 investigative modules. **Principles:** Clarity over decoration | Workflow efficiency | Information density | Professional trust --- ## Typography **Font Family:** IBM Plex Sans (UI), IBM Plex Mono (technical data) **Hierarchy:** - Page Titles: `text-3xl font-semibold` (36px) - Section Headers: `text-2xl font-semibold` (24px) - Card Titles: `text-lg font-medium` (18px) - Body: `text-base leading-relaxed` (16px) - Labels: `text-sm font-medium` (14px) - Captions: `text-xs` (12px) - Technical Data: `text-sm font-mono` (14px) - hashes, IPs, identifiers --- ## Layout & Spacing **Spacing Scale:** `2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 16` (Tailwind units) - Compact: `p-2 gap-2` - tables, toolbars - Standard: `p-4 gap-4` - cards, forms - Sections: `p-6 gap-6` - panels - Large: `p-8 gap-8` - page margins - XL: `p-12 gap-12` - dashboard columns - XXL: `p-16 gap-16` - page-level rhythm **Grids:** - Dashboard: `grid-cols-12` (sidebar + content) - Module Cards: `grid-cols-1 md:grid-cols-2 lg:grid-cols-3` - Split Views: 2-column comparison layouts - Tables: Full-width with `overflow-x-auto` **Containers:** - Sidebar: `w-64` (collapses to `w-16` icon-only) - Forms: `max-w-2xl` - Tables: `max-w-full` --- ## Navigation **Sidebar (Left, Fixed):** - 8 collapsible categories organizing 36 modules: 1. AI & Media (5): Deepfake, Image, Video, Audio, Steganography 2. Network & Comm (6): Network, Email, CDR/IPDR, Dark Web, Traffic, Browser 3. Device & Hardware (5): Mobile, Disk, Drone, Vehicle, GPS 4. Financial (4): Banking Fraud, AML/CTF, Financial/Corporate Audit 5. Social & OSINT (4): Social Media, OSINT, Face Recognition, Document Forgery 6. Security (4): Malware, Sandbox, Password Recovery, Quantum Crypto 7. Legal (4): Case Mgmt, E-Discovery, CSAM Controls, Audit Panel 8. Data & Cloud (4): Big Data, Cloud Evidence, Blockchain, Full Disk - Active module indicator | User profile at bottom | `h-16` header **Top Bar (`h-16`):** - Breadcrumbs | Global search (`min-w-96`) | Notifications | Active case | Quick actions | User avatar/role **Quick Access (`h-12`):** - Horizontal scrollable pinned favorites below top bar --- ## Core Components ### Dashboard KPI Cards ```html
[Metric]
[Label]
[Trend: +12%]
``` ### Case List Table - Sticky header, sortable columns - `h-14` rows, zebra striping - Columns: ID | Title | Status Badge | Priority | Assigned | Date | Actions (â‹®) - Hover state on full row ### Evidence Timeline - Vertical timeline with connection lines - `p-4 rounded-lg` cards per entry - Left: timestamp (`text-sm text-muted`) | Icon | Details | Chain-of-custody badge | Hash verification ### Forms ```html

[Helper text]

``` **File Upload:** `min-h-48 border-2 border-dashed` | Centered icon (`size-12`) | Instruction text | File restrictions ### Data Tables - Sticky header with sort indicators - Fixed-width for IDs/dates - Expandable rows, inline edit - Bulk select checkboxes - Pagination bottom-right (10/25/50/100) ### Modals **Evidence Detail:** `max-w-4xl max-h-screen overflow-y-auto` | Header with close | Tabbed interface | Right-aligned footer actions **Confirmation:** `max-w-md` centered | Icon | Clear primary action | Cancel button | Backdrop dismiss **Toasts:** Top-right | Auto-dismiss 5s | Progress bar | Icon + message + close | `max-w-sm` --- ## Specialized Forensics Components **Hash Verification:** ```html
Expected: [hash]
Actual: [hash]
âœ“ Match
``` **Chain-of-Custody Log:** Vertical timeline | Entry: timestamp, user, action, IP | Digital signature badge | Tamper-proof indicator **Image Comparison:** Before/After slider with draggable divider | Zoom controls | EXIF metadata panel | Tampering heatmap toggle **Audit Trail:** Filterable table | Expandable rows | Geolocation flags | Status indicators | CSV export --- ## Charts & Visualizations **Container Standard:** ```html

[Title]

[Chart Canvas]
[Legend]
``` **Types:** Line (trends) | Bar (comparisons) | Pie/Donut (distribution) | Network graphs | Heatmaps | Sankey (flows) --- ## Security Visual Language **Trust Indicators:** - âœ“ Verified badges (validated data) - ðŸ”’ Lock icons (encrypted) - ðŸ›¡ï¸ Shield (security-scanned) - âš ï¸ Warning triangles (flagged) **Access Control:** - Disabled state for unauthorized actions - Role badges next to usernames - Permission tooltips - Visible audit log icon **Data Integrity:** - Green checkmark: hash verified - Red alert: tamper detected - Chain-of-custody intact badge - Digital signature verification --- ## Icons **Library:** Lucide React **Sizes:** - Navigation: `size-5` (20px) + `mr-2` - Dashboard cards: `size-8` (32px, semi-transparent) - Buttons: `size-4` (16px) + `mr-1` - Status: `size-3` (12px) - File types: `size-6` (24px) **Custom:** Use `` placeholders --- ## Responsive Design **Breakpoints:** - **Mobile (<768px):** Single column | Hamburger menu | Stacked cards | Bottom tab nav | Sticky action buttons - **Tablet (768-1024px):** Icon-only sidebar | 2-column grids | Collapsible filters - **Desktop (>1024px):** Full sidebar | 3-4 column grids | Split views --- ## Role-Based UI **Admin:** Full access + system settings **Analyst:** Standard modules, no config **Supervisor:** Read-only + approval workflows **Auditor:** Audit trails + reports only **Personalization:** Draggable widgets | Pinned favorites | Recent cases | Custom metrics --- ## Interaction Patterns **Batch Operations:** Multi-select checkboxes â†’ bulk action toolbar â†’ confirmation â†’ progress indicator **Progressive Disclosure:** Summary cards with "View Details" | Collapsible advanced options | Tabbed multi-faceted data **Status Feedback:** Loading spinners | Success/error toasts | Inline validation | Progress bars for long operations --- **All components maintain:** Professional authority | High information density | Consistent spacing | Clear hierarchy | Accessibility compliance | Workflow optimization for investigators

import * as React from "react"
import * as ScrollAreaPrimitive from "@radix-ui/react-scroll-area"

import { cn } from "@/lib/utils"

const ScrollArea = React.forwardRef<
  React.ElementRef<typeof ScrollAreaPrimitive.Root>,
  React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef<typeof ScrollAreaPrimitive.Root>
>(({ className, children, ...props }, ref) => (
  <ScrollAreaPrimitive.Root
    ref={ref}
    className={cn("relative overflow-hidden", className)}
    {...props}
  >
    <ScrollAreaPrimitive.Viewport className="h-full w-full rounded-[inherit]">
      {children}
    </ScrollAreaPrimitive.Viewport>
    <ScrollBar />
    <ScrollAreaPrimitive.Corner />
  </ScrollAreaPrimitive.Root>
))
ScrollArea.displayName = ScrollAreaPrimitive.Root.displayName

const ScrollBar = React.forwardRef<
  React.ElementRef<typeof ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaScrollbar>,
  React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef<typeof ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaScrollbar>
>(({ className, orientation = "vertical", ...props }, ref) => (
  <ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaScrollbar
    ref={ref}
    orientation={orientation}
    className={cn(
      "flex touch-none select-none transition-colors",
      orientation === "vertical" &&
        "h-full w-2.5 border-l border-l-transparent p-[1px]",
      orientation === "horizontal" &&
        "h-2.5 flex-col border-t border-t-transparent p-[1px]",
      className
    )}
    {...props}
  >
    <ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaThumb className="relative flex-1 rounded-full bg-border" />
  </ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaScrollbar>
))
ScrollBar.displayName = ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaScrollbar.displayName

export { ScrollArea, ScrollBar }
